item.title: CREATE BROADCAST TABLE RULE
item.description: Description The CREATE BROADCAST TABLE RULE syntax is used to create broadcast table rules for tables that need to be broadcast (broadcast tables) Syntax Grammar Railroad diagram CreateBroadcastTableRule ::= 'CREATE' 'BROADCAST' 'TABLE' 'RULE' ifNotExists? tableName (',' tableName)* ifNotExists ::= 'IF' 'NOT' 'EXISTS' tableName ::= identifier Supplement tableName can use an existing table or a table that will be created; ifNotExists clause is used for avoid Duplicate Broadcast rule error.

item.title: DROP BROADCAST TABLE RULE
item.description: Description The DROP BROADCAST TABLE RULE syntax is used to drop broadcast table rule for specified broadcast tables Syntax Grammar Railroad diagram DropBroadcastTableRule ::= 'DROP' 'BROADCAST' 'TABLE' 'RULE' ifExists? tableName (',' tableName)* ifExists ::= 'IF' 'EXISTS' tableName ::= identifier Supplement tableName can use the table of existing broadcast rules; ifExists clause is used for avoid Broadcast rule not exists error. Example Drop broadcast table rule for specified broadcast table DROP BROADCAST TABLE RULE t_province, t_city; Drop broadcast table rule with ifExists clause DROP BROADCAST TABLE RULE IF EXISTS t_province, t_city; Reserved word DROP, BROADCAST, TABLE, RULE
